qas.question: What event pushed Hyderabad to the top of India's cultural centres?

answers.text: the decline of the Mughal Empire

qas.question: What major event in India in 1857 caused migration of peformance artists into Hyderabad?
What are the official languages of Telangana?
Which religious group holds the Eid ul-Fitr festival in Hyderabad?
The festival of Diwali is a tradition of what faith?

context: Hyderabad emerged as the foremost centre of culture in India with <a0_0>the decline of the Mughal Empire<a0_0/>. After <a1_0>the fall of Delhi<a1_0/> in 1857, the migration of performing artists to the city particularly from the north and west of the Indian sub continent, under the patronage of the Nizam, enriched the cultural milieu. This migration resulted in a mingling of North and South Indian languages, cultures and religions, which has since led to a co-existence of Hindu and Muslim traditions, for which the city has become noted.:viii A further consequence of this north–south mix is that both <a2_0>Telugu and Urdu<a2_0/> are official languages of Telangana. The mixing of religions has also resulted in many festivals being celebrated in Hyderabad such as Ganesh Chaturthi, Diwali and Bonalu of <a4_0>Hindu<a4_0/> tradition and Eid ul-Fitr and Eid al-Adha by <a3_0>Muslims<a3_0/>.
